title: GRE coaching advice
content: @seniors what is the right time to start preparing for GRE? And is the T.I.M.E GRE classes from PES (16k)  any good? If not what are some other good alternatives?

comments.body:
About 7-10 months before you want to take it. 
GRE is a marathon, not a sprint. So whatever coaching/crash course you take, you'll still have to do the same amount of work and of course, practice practice practice. 
A GRE instructor can teach you a lot of tricks, especially in the verbal section. However, a bunch of these are available through a YouTube search.

Dont know how good the coaching is but check out [gregmat.com](https://gregmat.com) its 5$ for excellent prep. I would advise against spending 16k on a GRE course unless you cant self study at all and absolutely need it.

Don't use any service for GRE or go to a consultancy. You'll find plenty of online resources. Gregmat and r/GRE are enough for prep. I'd recommend first figuring out where you want to go before writing the test since a lot of programs have waived it.
